comment: This class wasn't hard, but you definitely have to read and listen to the lectures and take good notes. The tests were open notes, open book, but timed. Overall it was a good class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: I specifically looked at the reviews. Big mistake. She gives no feedback. You get one attempt at the quiz and the answers are always hidden so you can't see what you missed and what to study for.  She gave zero feedback on assignments or quizzes.  The first week we had 17 assignments 3 quizzes and 1 exam to take over the course of 3 days.

Professor Lynch is the best professor I've had. She gave detailed feedback on assignments, made the content easy to understand, and went out of her way to help us succeed. She had an emergency last semester; she communicated that clearly and was flexible with assignment deadlines to make it fair for herself and for her students. Amazing instructor.

I'm surprised by the other students who rated her so far. She's been pretty nice and answered questions when I had them. She grades by the rubrics and gives them to us ahead of time. The presentations weren't too hard and weren't worth a lot, but the tests are. She's giving an optional final if any of us want to try to earn a better grade.

Good professor, watching lecture videos are very important! Use supplement material for exam 1 and 2.  grades presentations harsh.  1st presentation I lost points because I did not do a voice recording on the title slide and on the 2nd presentation I received a C! I am a A student. I worked hard on that presentation and followed her instructions.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Solid professor. She grades by a point system (which is scary) a lot of reading, lecture heavy, and textbook heavy. Provides two extra credit opportunities and drops two of your lowest quiz grades. Her exams are lock down browser use study guide/review sessions watch out for exam 1/2 watch supplemental videos/readings. Use rubric on presentations!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy

comment: The class is very straight forward, do the work and you will pass.

We did the class via Achieve and used iClicker. Easy A if you do the work. She drops your 2 lowest quizzes, 2 lowest iclicker quizzes and 1 lowest test. Most of the course is busy work, but nothing difficult. Only 4 discussion posts required in the semester. Extra credit was offered.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria
Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This class was really easy. She drops two quizzes and 1 exam. There is no excuse to not pass the class. Just read the chapters and do the modules and you should at least pass with a B.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: I literally got a 99 in this class. There is zero excuse not to pass this class. She's incredibly understanding and even drops several grades including 2 quizzes and 1 exam. The material is very easy to get through and understand and she has the best study guides. She is easy to reach and loves to meet with her students whenever they need help.

Made an account just to write about Professor Lynch. I am about to be a senior and have taken a lot of classes so I can safely say that this is the most interesting class I've ever taken. The readings are short and simple. The supplemental material was interesting. She had guest speakers. She is a very caring professor. She made online learning fun

I took Forensic Psychology because I found this topic interesting. People seemed to have rated her fair, but I really think she is a good professor. She genuinely cares about the material she teaches and that her students understand. I think she is a reasonable grader as well. And also, she loves if you bring your pet on zoom!!

I enjoyed the course overall. Every week: lots of reading from the online textbook, plus Launchpad assignments, question/discussion posts, and quizzes. The lectures are long. The quizzes and tests are pretty easy if you watch the lectures and read the chapters. Take good notes. She also gives study guides and optional reviews before each test.

Professor seems nice and caring, she is willing to do asynchronous meetings with students on exam reviews or getting tips and feedbacks about your paper. Please read thoroughly through the instructions when it comes to the writing assignments. Read the textbook and can use notes for chapter quizzes. She is a tough grader and barely passed her class
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Professor Lynch truly cares about her students and it shows. You are definitely expected to know the material, but she is available to help you. Listen to her lectures, take notes, and read the chapter each week. Short weekly quizzes. Two exams- gives out study guides which help greatly. Writing assignments are very doable! Would take again.

LOVE LOVE LOVEEEE HER!! Im in my first year and started the semester majoring in nursing, half way through the semester i decided i wanted to major in psychology based off her lectures! The case load is easy and shes very flexible! Her lectures provided everything on the test. Take notes and youll pass! Also when i changed my major she helped!
This not it. First-class I ever failed. Shouldn't be this hard but she makes t like that. Take at your own risk.
